description.narrative: The content and approach of CMI!’s L&A will be dependent on the category of key target actors such as donors, political

Within this strategy, the aim is for all CMI!’s members and strategic allies to engage in L&A for sustainable resourcing of WROs and movements, for law and policy change and implementation, and for shifts in social norms.

mailing-address.narrative: 1900 L Street NW Suite 504 Washington, DC 20036 United States

location.ref: Africa, Asia, Latin America and Europe/ International

comment.narrative: Influencing social justice movements to adopt feminist perspectives-influence related to the power and protections of WHRDs esp indigenous and land/territory defenders, women resisting extractives (e.g. with Special procedures, UN and regional bodies) -advocacy with local and national power holders for resources for women (access to services including health care, land etc)-influence to shift norms and values to counter fundamentalists and conservatives backlash on feminism and LGBTQI community -Reports that include (but are not limited to): -Achievements in advancing new policies, laws or norms (by donors, political, societal actors) in relation to women’s and girls‘ rights.- Successful passing of a proposal for improvement of existing policy, law or norm (for donors, political or societal actors). Expanded and more nuanced understanding of gender.- Successful blocking of a policy, law or norm (for donors, political or societal actors) that would have negatively impacted on the rights of women and girls.

Space was created at the UN for land defenders to engage special rapporteur. In all of the dialogues with the different special rapporteurs, the women human rights, land and territory defenders were able to share their contexts and the experiences they had with not only the special rapporteurs themselves but with other land and territory defenders as well. Instead of being spoken for, they were given a space to express themselves freely where their safety was also considered during the planning process. (e.g. which they were able to share whether they would like to use their real names or not)
